content: The Act titled "Higher Education Opportunity Act of 2007" introduces the Higher Education Opportunity Credit under Section 25A of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Higher Education Opportunity Credit allows eligible students to claim a tax credit for qualified tuition and related expenses. The credit is 100% of expenses up to $1,000, 50% for expenses between $1,000 and $3,000, and 20% for expenses between $3,000 and $5,500.
